title: Tearing / Stuttering issues with a new rig
body:
Recently I built a new PC;

GTX 1070
Intel i7 870
8GB RAM
WIN7
Not sure about monitor, but it's a HDTV 1842 x 1036 60hz

Normally with uncapped FPS I get average 150 - 200, but I'm not sure if it's screen tearing, but the games looks like it's running at 25ish FPS. I tried manually setting the FPS cap to 60 to prevent the "tearing" but it only makes the screen tearing so much more obvious and worse. When I try turning Vsync on, the map stutters and champions and minions slows down horribly. This is really annoying and I just want to be able to run League as smooth as my other games lol. I've tried borrowing my friends monitor which is 1920 x 1080 60hz, but it didn't fix anything. Any help would be much appreciated!

I'm sorry if I missed any important info or if I'm not understanding something. I'm very new to this type of stuff.

replies.body: A new rig requires a lot of love and tuning up to get to its best potential.  You may need to go through a series of Windows updates and checking on outdated drivers.  There could also be other issues, and our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) would be your best bet to rule out possibilities.  This should get you fixed up!

Nothing on there seems to be helping. I probably wasn't clear enough in my post, but the problem doesn't seem to be low FPS - it seems to be skipping some frames when uncapped. It always says I have 110+ frames even during large teamfights but it just doesn't look as smooth as it should be. It's weird how with my FPS capped at 60, my screen tears, but with Vsync on (60hz refresh rate, so it should still be capped at 60 fps) it just slows everything down and looks stuttery. Maybe it is a monitor problem
I have same problem , idk how to fix . I also used my old monitor and i get same problem . did you fix it ?
